content.text:
# List of awards and nominations received by Colin Farrell

}}
Colin Farrell is an Irish actor who has received various awards and nominations, including four Critics Choice Awards, three Golden Globe Awards and a Screen Actors Guild Award, in addition to nominations for an Academy Award, a BAFTA Award and two Primetime Emmy Awards.
After playing minor roles in film and on television, Farrell's first leading role was in Joel Schumacher's war drama Tigerland (2000), for which he won the Boston Society of Film Critics Award for Best Actor. For his role as Bullseye in the superhero film Daredevil (2003), he won the Teen Choice Award for Choice Movie Villain and was nominated for the MTV Movie Award for Best Villain. Farrell won the Golden Globe Award for Best Actor in a Motion Picture – Musical or Comedy for his role as a novice hitman in the dark comedy In Bruges (2008), his first film with frequent collaborator Martin McDonagh. Farrell received his second Golden Globe nomination for his role in Yorgos Lanthimos' dark comedy The Lobster (2015).
For his leading role in McDonagh's black tragicomedy The Banshees of Inisherin (2022), Farrell won several film critics' awards, as well as the Volpi Cup for Best Actor at the Venice International Film Festival and his second Golden Globe Award for Best Actor in a Motion Picture – Musical or Comedy. Farrell also earned his first nominations for the Academy Award, BAFTA Award, Critics Choice Award, and Screen Actors Guild Award for Best Actor. That same year he acted in the Kogonada science fiction film After Yang, for which he was nominated for the Critics' Choice Super Award for Best Actor in a Science Fiction/Fantasy Movie and the Gotham Independent Film Award for Outstanding Lead Performance.
Farrell played Oz Cobb / The Penguin in the superhero film The Batman (2022), which earned him the Critics' Choice Super Award for Best Actor in a Superhero Movie. He reprised his role in the HBO miniseries The Penguin (2024), for which he was nominated for the Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Limited or Anthology Series or Movie. He won a Critics Choice Award, a Golden Globe Award and a Screen Actors Guild Award in the same category, as well as two Critics' Choice Super Awards.
